q: How do I get more information about the Digital Manufacturing Commons?
a:
To learn more about the DMC, we ask that you utilize any and all of the links below:
  • Confluence Documentation: https://digitalmfgcommons.atlassian.net/wiki/display/DMDIIDMC/Digital+Manufacturing+Commons+Home
  • OpenDMC.org: http://opendmc.org/
  • UI LABS Website: http://www.uilabs.org/innovation-platforms/manufacturing/dmc/
  • OpenDMC About page at Portal post login: https://portal.opendmc.org/onboarding.php#/home

q: I've created and account and logged into the website, but I don't seem to have access or the ability to do anything all. Is the site broken?
a: Our platform is currently in a closed beta. What his means for your account is that until your organization administrator verifies that you a member of their organization, you will not be able to have access to the DMC. Currently the only organizations which have organization administrators to help you get through the verification process are DMDII member organization. We do offer an alternative method to get access to our platform during our closed beta, where you need to associate your account with the Digital Manufacturing Commons organization and then e-mail us at askdmc@uilabs.org to receive a verification token to give your account general site functionality.

q: When onboarding, my organization does not appear in the auto-complete drop-down list? Can I still get access to the DMC's features?
a:
If during the onboarding steps of account creation your organization does not appear in the auto-complete list, find the appropriate case below
  • My Organization is a member of DMDII:
    • Please e-mail your membership contact at DMDII or e-mail the DMC at askdmc@uilabs.org
  • My Organization is not a member of DMDII:
    • During the closed beta, the DMC can still be accessed by means of joining the Digital Manufacturing Commons organization on the DMC, then e-mailing askdmc@uilabs.org to let us know you would like to have access the DMC and its features.
    • Once we are out of our closed beta time, users from organizations that are not members of DMDII can create new organizations, documentation for which will be provided later on.

q: How can I visit my organization's profile page and well as other organization pages?
a:
• Your organization's profile page:
    • Click on My Organization from the top menu
  • Other organizations' pages:
    1. Click on Explore in the top menu
    2. Choose Organization from the drop-down that appears
    3. Find or search for the organization you are interested in
    4. Click on the name of the organization on the organization's card

q: I think the information my organization's profile page is outdated or needs to be updated. How do I go about making these changes?
a:
If the information such as your organization description or logo needs to be updated, your organization administrator (who's card is outlined in green and has a green admin stamp on their card when visiting the organization's profile page), will need to do the following:
  • Visit the organization page by clicking My Organization which appears oin the top menu
  • Click on the Edit Company which appears near the top of the organization profile page (organization administrators only)
  • Make the necessary changes, and click the green Save button in the top right hand corner of the page

q: How do I view my profile, as well as other users' profile pages?
a:
To view user profile pages do the following:
  • Your Profile Page
    1. Click on your display-name in the top right hand corner of any page on the DMC
    2. Choose My Profile from the drop down that appears
  • Other User Profiles:
    1. Click on Explore in the top menu
    2. Choose Individuals from the drop-down that appears
    3. Find or search for the user that you are interested in
    4. Click on the name of the user on their card

q: How do I update my profile page?
a:
To update your user profile page, do the following:
  1. Click on your display-name in the top right hand corner of any page
  2. Choose My Profile from the drop-down that appears
  3. Click on edit profile button near the top of the page
  4. Make the changes such as uploading a profile picture, adding a description, job title, skills, and location
  5. When done, click on the green Save button in the top right hand corner of the form to save your changes

q: I've heard the DMC team uses an agile development process. Where can I find more information about what went into each of the releases?
a:
1. Visit our Confluence documentation here
  2. On the left hand side notice the tree
  3. Choose the particular release you are interested in reading feature changes for
